original: 18.17. Āsavasampayuttaduka, Hetuduka🔽Āsavasampayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavasampayutto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Āsavavippayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavavippayutto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: āsava sampayutta duka hetu duka  āsava sampayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca na āsava sampayuttaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  āsava vippayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca na āsava vippayuttaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: The Section on the Pairs in the Chapter on the Conditions🔽With root cause, with taints, and so on🔽With root cause, with taints, and so on🔽With root cause, with taints, and so on🔽With root cause, with taints, and so on

original: Āsavasampayuttaṁ hetuñca āsavavippayuttaṁ hetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavasampayutto🔽nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi

analyzed: pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava
translated: With root cause, with taints, and so on

original: Āsavasampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavasampayutto nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: āsava sampayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na āsava sampayuttaḥ na na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi

original: Āsavavippayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naāsavasampayutto nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cattāri …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate cattāri.
analyzed: āsava vippayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na āsava sampayuttaḥ na na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka saṅkhitta hetuyā cattāri pe vipāke ekam pe avigate cattāri
translated: With a non-rootless, not-subject-to-cancelling Dhamma as condition there arises a non-rootless, subject-to-cancelling Dhamma by way of root condition. … (Abbreviated.) With a root as condition there are four … With a ripening as condition there is one … With an indeterminate as condition there are four.
